snippet: The Obama administration has put off another provision — on deductibles and co-payments — until 2015.
abstract: Obama administration delays until 2015 a provision of health care law that limits consumer costs, another setback for health care initiative; limit on out-of-pocket costs, including deductibles and co-payments, was not supposed to exceed $6,350 for an individual and $12,700 for a family, but under a little-noticed ruling, federal officials have granted a one-year grace period to some insurers, allowing them to set higher limits, or no limit at all on some costs, in 2014.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration has put off another provision — on deductibles and co-payments — until 2015.

headline.main: A Limit on Consumer Costs Is Delayed in Health Care Law
headline.print_headline: A Limit on Consumer Costs Is Delayed in Health Care Law

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
